name: Quarto com Graça a 5 min metro intendente
description:
Room for one person or couple in the city centre of Lisbon, 15 minutes walking from castle and downtown. You can walk to the main places of Lisbon.
Room with lots of light and very cozy.
Kitchen use restricted to vegan or vegetarian.
A wonderful view of the city from the balcony.
Breakfast available if booking in advance.
Internet and Heating available and a small working place with lots of sun and a beautiful view of the city.
neighborhood_overview:
Localized between Graça and Intendente you can really have a traditional Lisbon experience.
In Graça you have one of the best views of Lisbon with lots of little bars and cafes full of a special style between modern and traditional.
Intendente is a renewed neighborhood full of restaurants and city life.
On top you have the castle at 10 min walk and you can take the tram to Bairro Alto. Full of history and tradition os one of the best places to visit with no rush.
host_about: A minha casa é a minha bolha privada onde gosto de me mimar, meditar, praticar yoga, ler, estar comigo mesma e amigos.

name: BIG 3 BD CHARM&LIGHT #greenstreet
description: Located in the trendy, charming and pedestrian #greenstreet, this big 115 m2 apartment has it all: Charm and Design melted in the historic center and close to Bica, Cais do Sodré, Bairro Alto, Chiado, Principe Real… well you can walk everywhere from the apartment and visit this fantastic city. Welcome and enjoy! Bring confortable shoes to visit Lisboa, the 7 hills city! Use Apps Uber and Bolt for rides.
neighborhood_overview:
Since being branded the Santos Design District in 2005 , this waterside quarter has attract ed artists, designers, architects and other creative types to live, work and play there, no doubt helped by the fact that the Instituto de Artes Visuais, Design e Marketing sits at its centre. Plans are currently underway for a grand, residential and commercial complex to be built by Norman Foster on the area's Boavista site, which will provide a vast area for even more galleries, studios, design outlets, restaurants and bars to emerge.

The traditional sits happily with the modern in Santos, where dusty homes with wrought-iron balconies and 19th-century warehouses share streets with sleek shops, hip cafes and new conversions. A calm area during the day, with a small park and square, at night it gets a little more crowded as restaurants begin to fill and bars come to life. Bairro Alto next door may be better known for its abundance of night life, but what it doesn't have is the Tagus r

neighborhood_overview: Pé da Serra is a charming crossroads between the Serra and the rolling hills and beaches of the coast of Colares.  There are 2 charming establishments at this crossroads, one Flores do Cabo, a large old converted warehouse where there are musical and art events, wine and food and a variety of high quality furniture and soft furnishing.  The other place of interest is another converted warehouse run by an antique dealer who specialises in object d'art, Indian clothing and fabrics, jewelry and ceramics.

name: Cozy Apartment with Private Terrace - Bairro Alto
description: The apartment is on the 2nd floor and its location is unrivaled in Lisbon: it is in Bairro Alto, an old and picturesque neighborhood, a reflection of an extraordinary bohemian culture, with traditional shops and, since the 1980s, it has been the most known in the center of Lisbon, with restaurants, taverns, fado houses and art galleries, numerous bars and clubs in an unspeakable hustle and bustle, from 7pm to 3am. It is the ideal place for a fun holiday, close to everything.
neighborhood_overview:
In some of Lisbon’s oldest and most traditional neighbourhoods, you’ll find a nightlife and festive spirit that you’ll find hard to believe in the centre of the city. The streets fill with people of all ages who come to catch up, have a drink, watch the people passing by and discover all the many new things there are to be found.
There’s little point asking a Lisboeta where the best place is to go out at night. The whole city meets at the centre of its nightlife, where there are places to suit every taste and music for every genre. The more experienced guarantee that Lisbon’s nightlife consists of a steady downhill motion – and the more poetic of them swear that every conversation is spoken in italics. Why? Because it always begins in Bairro Alto with its many and varied bars and restaurants, then heads down to Bica with a glass in hand and always ends in Cais do Sodré, where the most popular nightclubs intermingle with the old sailors’ bars, combining an original mix of cultures
host_about:
Degree in Classical Philology Faculty of Arts, University of Coimbra, attended the Doctorate "Alemana Culture, Italian, Portuguese y French", in Salamanca. I admit being a passionate about the media press, the Linguistics and Literature. It is Lisbon, the city most beautiful in the world, and where I am happy to live and smile, that all I address a cordial greeting.
There is an excerpt from the work of Fernando Pessoa with which I identify myself: «I want to raise my arms and shout things from a dropped savagery, to say words to the higher mysteries, to assert a new personality to the great wide spaces of the empty field.

Licenciado em Filologia Clássica pela Faculdade de Letras da Universidade de Coimbra, frequentei o Doctorado “Cultura Alemana, Italiana, Portuguesa y Francesa", em Salamanca. Admito ser um apaixonado pelos «media», pela Linguística e Literatura. É de Lisboa, a cidade mais bonita do mundo, e onde tenho a felicidade de viver e de sorrir, que a todos dirijo um cordial cumprimento. 
Há um excerto da obra de Fernando Pessoa com o qual me identifico: «Tenho vontade de erguer os braços e gritar coisas de uma selvajaria ignorada, de dizer palavras aos mistérios altos, de afirmar uma nova personalidade larga aos grandes espaços da matéria vazia».

name: Bohemian two bedroom apartment with garden patio
description:
This is my home for over 15 years and I really like it!

I'm generally interested in people who wish to stay a minimum of a few weeks to a month.

The area is not touristy at all, about 15 minutes on a bus to the city centre and an 8 minute walk to the river and Belem, where you can eat the famous pastel de nata! Yum!

There are really nice cafe's in the area, and two places to do Yoga.

LX factory in Alcantara 10 minutes away by bus.
neighborhood_overview: Ajuda! Lisbon city is built on seven hills, which is one of the reasons that makes it such an amazing and unique place. Ajuda is the seventh hill, its a short walk to the river and to the famous touristy area of Belem. I love the old tram that goes here, in fact its the only one that is used more by residents then tourists!
host_about:
Originally a biologist, with a PhD in the intersection between art and science. I think Lisbon is a special place. I've been living in Lisbon for over 15 years now, and was born very close to the apartment that I rent on airbnb.

I like good food and reading books, and am into meditation and yoga.

name: Alfama Terrace on Tejo
neighborhood_overview:
The Alfama district is the oldest district of Lisbon, the only one that survived the earthquake of 1755. It has kept its village atmosphere with its narrow streets, hundreds of stairs, dead ends and “Becos”. There is a mysterious atmosphere! We hope you enjoy getting lost in this labyrinth. Two beautiful white churches nearby: Sao Miguel and San Estevao.

You will reside in the heart of the Fado district in a remarkable environment while staying close to the most important tourist places of the capital. You will be a few minutes walk from the Praça do Commercio (the most central place in Lisbon, where you will find the tourist office) and the Baixa district. A very good place to go shopping, you will find international brands such as traditional Portuguese clothing and decoration shops.
host_about:
We are a couple living between Paris & Lisboa and our jobs allow us to travel frequently. That's fortunate cause we are very curious about people and culture!

We enjoy walking, reading, watching and learning from others.
We are also quite sporty, we like mountains and seas and we are obsessed by cooking and gastronomy (that's our french side...)

We are happy to share our apartement with our future guests because we furnished it with a lot of care. We tried to decorate it as à nest so you can feel at home. We are very cautious about the furniture and decoration: we try to choose local, solid and comfortable stuff. 

Unfortunately we won't be able to always welcome you but we work with professionnal people on who we trust. They will take care of you and introduce you to our appartment. You will find some tips and advices about Lisboa and Paris in our flat.

Welcome home!
Quiterie & Romain

name: Quinta de São Thiago - Guest House
description:
Historical farm house in the heart of Sintra mountain.
Guest House for up to 20 people (10 bedrooms) in exclusive (family members living permanently).
Kitchen not available, meals possibility on request.
Exceptional conditions for events/wedding parties (special fee for the use of the events area). Detailed information by email.
neighborhood_overview:
What to say about Sintra? It is famous for its many palaces,quintas and the luxurious gardens. Also for the proximity of the Atlantic coast, offering wonderfull beaches.
All the mountain is a UNESCO heritage site, offering the opportunity to discover magical and mystical places.
host_about:
Na Quinta de São Thiago os hóspedes são tratados não apenas como clientes, mas sobretudo como amigos e família.
O nosso objectivo é proporcionar-lhe uma estadia inesquecível!
Sentimos um enorme orgulho pelas centenas de comentários deixados pelos hóspedes no Livro de Honra, ao longo destes 30 anos de actividade.
É aconselhável trazer um carro, pois a quinta fica cerca de 6 quilómetros distante do centro histórico. Por essa mesma razão, somos o local ideal para desfrutar da tranquilidade que procura! 

E.N. 375, Rua do Regueirinho, 2710-405 EN 375, (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) , Portugal

neighborhood_overview:
Obviously there are many bars and restaurants because Bairro Alto has always been a very bohemian neighborhood. Formerly it was one of the neighborhoods of the houses of fado, the prostitution, the musicians and where were the Newspapers, reason why it was a neighborhood always nocturnal.
Nowadays there are many bars and restaurants and some alternative shops and Portuguese designers. Just leave the Bairro and go to the Chiado and the Baixa to find the mainstream stores and go to Avenida da Liberdade for the haute couture stores

I love to travel, to dance, to watch Tv series, and to watch contemporary performing arts.

name: Parede-Cascais Bay View Duplex
description:
Confortable duplex apartment in the heart of the beach village of Parede, coast of Cascais. Next to the beaches of Parede, Avencas, Carcavelos and the Casino of Estoril. Pleasant, relax and warm Portuguese Riviera atmosphere. Recently renewd apartment.

Closed to restaurants, cafés, supermarkets, bookshop and grocery stores. 3 minutes walk to the train station and 5 min to the seashore, 10 minutes drive to the Casino of Estoril. Trains to downtown Lisbon and Cascais each 20 minutes.
neighborhood_overview:
Parede is part of the lively and cosmopolitan municipality of Cascais, in the Cost of the Sun in Portugal. The apartment is located on a second floor of a cozy building in a quiet road, in the center of Parede Village Beach.

The apartment is circa 500 meters from the seashore. It is closed to supermarkets, restaurants, coffee-shops, drugstore, bookstore, shopping malls, gym and playground for children.

One special attraction of the area is the Public Market of Parede, where you can buy fresh fish, vegetables and fruits to cook your own dinner at home after spending the day on the beach. At Pingo Doce supermarket you find good Portuguese wines.

On a 5 minute walking distance you have the Parede Beach and Avencas Beach. Surf, Paddle surf, Windsurf, Cycling, Golf, Sailing and Tennis are sports attractions in the region.

The Estoril Casino and downtown Cascais are in a distance of 4 km and 6 km respectivelly.

Not very far lies Gu
host_about: We are a couple with two kids and we love the Portuguese Coast of the Sun.

neighborhood_overview:
Quinta da Condeça is located in the central region of Portugal, in the village of BARREIRAS near the coast, north of Lisbon, about 70 km from the airport which is located along the northern border of the city.

Quinta da Condeça is ideally placed to reach multiple sites of great interest in less than an hour ( 15 minutes to 45 minutes and within 20 to 90 kms!), which makes it an excellent tourist base to go touring, for a first discovery of this country, not known enough, in our opinion.

Similarly, a diverse range of sports and other activities is available nearby (within 5 to 25 kms) , to allow you to spend a both enjoyable and dynamic stay, if you want.

name: Aldeia da Mata Pequena (2 persons)
description: Aldeia da Mata Pequena, an old village carefully restored invites to explore nature and built heritage of its surroundings. 13 houses offering a B&B, self-catering and comfortable accommodation in a traditional atmosphere.
neighborhood_overview:
Situated barely 30 minutes from the capital Lisbon, Aldeia da Mata Pequena is also close to beautiful beaches and historic places, offering excellent opportunities for outdoor activities.

It is located within the Special Protection Area of Penedo do Lexim, an extinct volcano, where there is an important archaeological site. Proud eagles and stealthy foxes inhabit an extremely rich and well-preserved natural landscape, inviting visitors to relax, to indulge in leisure activities and to be in contact with nature.

name: Casa Azul - Blue House
description: Located at the back of the garden of the main house, next to the swimming pool accessible to tenants in fine weather, Casa Azul is composed of 2 bedrooms, a fully equipped kitchen and a bathroom. The house of 70m2 is decorated in a cozy style, with a large living / dining room that opens onto a sunny terrace with a barbecue and a private garden for sunbathing, under the benevolent eye of the fake cow. Perfect for a family holiday or to discover Lisbon ...
neighborhood_overview:
In a residential and family area, the house is located less than 10 minutes from the train station "Oeiras", with a train every 10 minutes, which will take you in fifteen minutes in the center of Lisbon or to Estoril, Cascais ...
The beach or marina of Oeiras is 15 minutes walk from Casa Azul. The historic center, its palace and its shops are also easily accessible.
For the daily, restaurants and convenience stores are 5 minutes walk and shopping centers are 5 minutes by car.
host_about:
Nous sommes un couple qui évoluons dans le milieu de la décoration, aussi bien d'intérieur que dans l'évènementiel. Nous avons beaucoup voyagé et nous aimons découvrir de nouveaux modes de vie, de nouvelles personnes. Maintenant, nous aimons recevoir des hôtes pour continuer à nous évader...

And in english, we are a couple involved in decoration areas, as well as in indoor decoration or for events. We traveled a lot and we love discovering new lifestyles, new people. Now, we like to welcome guests to keep us away ...

name: Morada Sol - Jasmin by Sol Domus
description: Jasmin is a cosy one floor house within a 5000m2 estate with gardens and swimming pool. Located in Cascais-Sintra national park, 3km from world-famous Guincho sandy beach, close to Lisbon airport and many sights.
neighborhood_overview:
The house is ideally situated in a rural setting, at the foot of the Sintra hills, 3km from beautiful Guincho beach and 6km from cosmopolitan Cascais and Estoril. This is a perfect location for nature lovers, being in the Sintra-Cascais protected National Park where building is very restricted.
The village of Malveira da Serra is less than five minutes walk away, with a range of shops and restaurants. The village retains its traditional charm as building is restricted, and has long been sought after due to the beauty of its setting, with the coast stretched out below, and the forest and mountains above.

name: Quinta da Condeça XVIIIth c. + Swimming pool 18x6m
description:
***** -30% up to -40% for weekly reservations (select 7 nights). *****

3 houses x 6 persons + Swimming pool 18x6x2

Quinta da Condeça is a recently renovated mansion with swimming pool in the central region of Lisbon, typical of the gracious architecture from the late 18th to the mid-19th centuries.
The ideal starting point for your holiday excursions to the sea or the countryside!

***** More information, pictures and video on our website quintadacondeca. *****
neighborhood_overview:
Quinta da Condeça is located in the central region of Portugal, in the village of BARREIRAS near the coast, north of Lisbon, about 70 km from the airport which is located along the northern border of the city.

Quinta da Condeça is ideally placed to reach multiple sites of great interest in less than an hour ( 15 minutes to 45 minutes and within 20 to 90 kms!), which makes it an excellent tourist base to go touring, for a first discovery of this country, not known enough, in our opinion.

Similarly, a diverse range of sports and other activities is available nearby (within 5 to 25 kms) , to allow you to spend a both enjoyable and dynamic stay, if you want.
host_about: Ancien cadre supérieur expatrié de longues années au Portugal et connaissant parfaitement la région, désormais installé là-bas, je mets à disposition 3 maisons meublées et totalement autonomes.

name: Grow Your Happiness - Lisbon Room
description:
Cozy nice room for 1 persons. The apartment its ubicate in a national heritage building in 1 of the most beautiful charming hills of Lisbon (Lapa). Central residencial area, really calm and safe. We are really near the parliament building, this is the embassy district, close to the downtown and the lisboneers favorite places Bairro Alto, etc.
You can find all the comfort nearby, bus, tram, small restaurants, supermarket and local grocery shops.
Come share Lisbon life with resident people!
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood its really calm and central at the same time. Its one of the most beautiful district of the historical part of Lisboa with a lot of charm and really nice environment. Its also mostly lived by locals. So its means that is not so tourist as other ares of the city. We are on a hill, good for the people who like to walk : )
You can, anyway, walk every were from here, reach bairo alto in 15 min,
Cais Sodré 20 min, Rato 15 min etc...

At same time you have buses just outside the door. Metro at 15/20 minuts walking.
The district its part of historical center, but mostly residencial area, although you can find every kind of comfort really near, like market, local shop, delicious pastry shop and small and cheep restaurant when you can eat easily.This is also one (of maybe the most) safe district of the city, this because all the embassy are here and also we are 5 minute walking from the Parliament building.

It is really nice just to walk
host_about: Im Italian, living in Portugal since almost 10 years. Im calm person, easy and with a good vibe, I guess : ) I've a degree in sociology and anthropology but nowadays im teaching Italian and Yoga. I love nature, music (Jazz, reggae,funk), Yoga and all about permaculture.  When I can, I take refuge in the mother nature - Mahá Shakti.

name: Rooms in a country house in the city
description: Renovated typical house, dated from the 1700's. With a porch (ideal for breakfast in the summer), a big shared kitchen, a bathroom and a small backyard. 2 very silent rooms available: 1 for a couple; 1 with 2 single beds. 15 min by bus to the center.
neighborhood_overview: In front of the river Tejo, the very old neighborhood of Xabregas is, along with the close-by Marvila, one of the last untouched neighborhoods of Lisbon, to have stayed typical and untouched by the touristic boom of the city. It's a place where real people live, a very safe, pleasant and quiet part of the city.
host_about:
Hi everybody! 
I am from Lisbon, and so is my family.  Born, raised and living here, I guess we know this city like the palms of our hands. It will be a pleasure to welcome you here and advise you on anything you need. From the most beautiful places in the city, to the most secret ones, and from museums or restaurants, to curiosities no guide will tell you — you tell me what you like and I'll tell you where you'll find it. Looking forward to meeting you.

name: St. George Castle Apartment
description: Fully equipped apartment with superb views of Lisbon in the historic area of Saint George castle.
neighborhood_overview:
The castle, the Moorish fence (Cerca Moura), Saint Vincent Church and Feira da Ladra (the flea market: Tuesdays and Saturdays), the districts of Graça, Alfama, and Mouraria are at a distance of a short walk, as well as downtown Lisbon.
Nearby you can find several restaurants, cafes or bars.
host_about: Born, live and work in Lisbon, a city that I consider one of the most beautiful in the world. History, diversity and natural contrasts, the light and the mild climate, security, cultural and gastronomic offer are some of the reasons that make me stay in the city which also saw the birth of my daughters. I'm 58, working at the portuguese media regulator. I love to travel and innovative music.

name: Aptmt with 90m2 private garden
description:
Our apartment has a 90m2 private garden with charming dining space among orange trees and a wood-fired oven.

There is also a small barbecue. The kitchen has a SMEG oven/6-hob cooker.

We have 3 beds, of which one is a bunk and one is a double.
neighborhood_overview:
Lisbon's wonderful fresh fish market "Mercado 31 de Janeiro" is at the end of our road (just turn left out of front door). It also sells great-tasting local fresh veg and olives, chouriço etc. and has an Italian deli and a good little bread shop. NB. the market is closed in the afternoons and Sundays.

Shopping and cinema is a 5-minute walk to the Saldanha round-about.

Everywhere in Lisbon is a 15-minute Uber/taxi ride, we are very central. 10- to 15-minute walk to Mouraria, the 'old' Lisbon of steep, narrow cobbled streets, fado and life outdoors.

Lisbon's bullfighting arena, "Campo Pequeno" is a very short hop in a taxi if this kind of thing interests you. Be warned though - bulls are stabbed! They are not killed however in the Portuguese version. Instead the bull-fighters, completely unarmed, try and swarm the bull.

Nearest supermarket is good, well stocked and called "Continente": turn right out of the apartment down our street. At crossro

name: Piano house in the heart of Lisbon
description: Our apartment is roomy and cosy at the same time. Every detail was planed to provide the maximum comfort to its inhabitants. It is located in Anjos neighborhood, one of the youngest and more interesting neighborhoods in the centre of Lisbon!
neighborhood_overview: Anjos is perhaps the most youth-attracting neighborhood in Lisbon. 15 minutes walk or three metro stations far from downtown. Quiet enough to have good rest, but also close to seething local coffee shops and cultural associations. It is also located at walking distance from the historical neighborhoods Graça and Mouraria.
host_about: Brother and sister born in the heart of Lisbon. We love the sun, traveling, good food and reading. We will welcome you with a warm smile and available to present you this small town full of surprises. We’ll be happy to provide you and unforgettable experience. See you soon!

name: Cosy Flat In Central Lisbon With Castle View
description:
Bright and cosy apartment in a quiet street in Lisbon city centre. Located 20 meters away from the Italian ambassy, the area is also very safe during the day and by night.
Ideal for a family trip with children or for a group of friends, the flat in the street of Castelinhos on the 4th floor (no lift) benefits from a magnificient view on the castle of Lisbon and the street Batista.
neighborhood_overview:
This neighborhood called Intendente or "Bairro de Pena" is the place where you will live authentic Portuguese life by eating homemade dishes in the very cheap restaurants of the neighborhood, still owned by the grandmothers.
All shops nearby (no car needed).

Pena is also known as a very lively area since the Middle Ages, which has retained a typical architecture after the great earthquake of 1755. The artistic soul full of history of Pena still remains today through the beauty of the Buildings, trendy bars and restaurants as well as many outdoor music events throughout the summer. You will have the choice between enjoying Lisbon's artistic and "underground" nightlife in Intendente or walking 15-20mn to enjoy the crowded nightlife of Cais de Sodré or Bairro Alto.

name: Colares / Galadriel Villa
description:
Janas is a safe and quiet village close to Azenhas do Mar, Sintra, ideal for an unforgettable holiday with family and/or friends.
One-storey Villa
The main one-storey villa features 3 bedrooms (one master room en suite), 3 bathrooms; large open-planned fully-equipped kitchen, dining room, living room; large private garden; private swimming pool with deck.
The swimming pool house features an open-planned fully equipped two sink kitchen, a living room/recreation area, a bathroom, an outdoor stone grill area with a BBQ, a clay oven and an outdoor sink.
neighborhood_overview:
LOCAL ATTRACTIONS
Nearby beaches (within a 10-minute driving distance): Azenhas do Mar (excellent for surfing), Aguda (2 km), Praia das Maçãs (3 km), Praia Grande (5 km), Magoito (6 km), Praia da Adraga (7 km), Praia da Ursa (10 km), Guincho (17 km) well-known for its excellent windsurfing and kite surfing conditions;

Nearby golf courses: Penha Longa (19 holes), 16,5 km; Belas Clube do Campo (18 holes), 20,9 km; Quinta da Marinha (18 holes), 20,1 km; Golfe do Estoril (18 holes), 20,3 km; Quinta de Beloura (9 holes), 13,5 km; Estoril Sol (9 holes), 20,9 km.

Other nearby attractions: Cabo da Roca (the most westerly point of continental Europe and several typical villages (e.g. Colares, Almoçageme, Azenhas do Mar, Gouveia, Fontanelas)

Kids park: 10-minute driving distance

Lisbon airport : 40 km (25 miles)

name: Modern Oasis w/ Garden & Rooftop, Praça das Flores
description: Giant private roof terrace & garden in the middle of Lisbon! neighborhood_overview:
Imagine: You wake up with a coffee from Albi (next door!) then walk (4min) to Marquise for a fresh croissant that you enjoy in the park, Praca Das Flores. Maybe do some work in one of the several modern cafes with incredible food. Otherwise, you're just minutes walking from Principe Real if you want to shop or explore different restaurants and later on bars. Want to explore the city, just walk towards to water and enjoy the view over the famous 25 e Abril bridge Sanctuary of Christ the King.

name: Guincho Cottage with stunning Ocean views
description:
Guincho Cottage is a sweet and typical Portuguese cottage, located in the heights of the up-and-coming "surf hub" village of Charneca. It is the ideal place for a family or small group of friends who enjoy nature, the outdoors, the Atlantic, the surf.
The entrance of the cottage will greet you with lovely Bougainvillea. Inside, there are 2 bedrooms, a living area with a comfortable sofa bed, 2 bathrooms and a fully equipped kitchen.
neighborhood_overview: Charneca is a small and typical Portuguese village only 5 minutes’ drive from Cascais and 10 minutes from Estoril. The stunning Guincho beach (where you will be able to surf, windsurf, chill out at the beach bar or simply soak up the sun!) is a couple of minutes’ drive away, or 15-20 minutes’ walk from the cottage, through a beautiful green valley in the Sintra-Cascais Natural Park. In Charneca, there is a small supermarket, a couple of local cafés, a restaurant, an equestrian centre, a tennis court, as well as a bus stop. Within a couple of minutes’ drive, you will reach the nearby villages of Aldeia de Juso and Areia. Aldeia de Juso is the place to go if you want fresh local produce, and Areia is the “surfer hub” of Cascais, being right next to the Guincho sand-dunes, with a wide variety of local cafes and lively restaurants, suited to everyone’s price range! Even though a quiet and peaceful location in which to spend relaxing holidays, the village of Charneca is only 2,5 km away fro
host_about:
My Friends' Houses is a network of rental accommodation in the UK, Portugal, Greece, France and Bali. Despite the diverse scope of the holiday destinations the common thread is that all the homes available provide a cosy, well loved environment with on hand support and advice if required.
We work closely with all of our owners to ensure their houses meet a high standard. When our guests arrive at My Friends' Houses, they can immediately enjoy and relax! 
It is important to us that from the moment you put down your suitcase you feel comfortable and able to kick back and enjoy your holiday.

All our houses are handpicked and the regions we work with are well known to us. This way, we can give real advice to our guests and make them feel like staying at a “Friend’s House”.
We offer a variety of activities and places where you will be able to go and be received “like a friend”.  We can recommend the best contacts for yoga, surfing, kite-surfing, paddle boarding, eco tourism and bird watching, sailing, trekking, horse-riding, tennis, massages and beauty treatments, cultural and historical tours as well as amazing gastronomic experiences!
Anything else you fancy, let us know and we will find a way to provide it!
We look forward to welcoming you at “My Friends’ Houses”.

host_about: Nasci em Lisboa e adoro viajar. Gosto de aprender idiomas, conhecer outras culturas, saborear outras gastronomias, apreciar outras músicas. Ou seja, gosto de todas as formas de viajar. Contudo, adoro o meu País e acho que é um dos mais belos que já conheci. Gosto de conhecer pessoas e poder mostrar-lhes o melhor da minha cidade e fazer sentirem-se bem-vindos.

name: Enjoy Lisbon with a local artist
description:
Enjoy your days in Lisbon at the home of a Portuguese visual artist who enjoys welcoming and sharing tips and suggestions from the city.
In a typical Lisbon apartment, close to countless points of interest and good restaurants, come and be inspired and relax, while exploring Lisbon!
neighborhood_overview:
Situated in the most multicultural and young Lisbon neighborhood, here you can find all the trends and classics, in a chaotic but cheerful mix. Every day vegan options and shops or spaces of dynamics open, and it is one of the first viewpoints not only for the view of the city but also for your life.
Near all accesses and 5 minutes from downtown, still with a neighborhood breath.
The apartment is 2 min walk from the metro and is the best light room of the house.
host_about:
I'm easy going and always enjoy meeting new people. I love arts and music, and I love to travel, every chance I have.
I enjoy debating and sharing ideas, learning, observing, reading.

Iuri is the black cat in the house, playfull and very fun of people, enjoys having company and trying to follow everybody to the bathroom.

name: Confortable and Spacious T1 flat
description:
Located in the the cosmopolitan area of Parque das Nações the apartment is right by the Tagus River, perfect for anyone who wants to visit Lisbon and enjoy the neighborhood.

Nearby there is one one of the largest and most beautiful Lisbon green parks - Parque Tejo. It's also near everything you need: supermarket, fresh fruits, pharmacy, police station, gymn, pools, bars, restaurants...

Car parking is free in the area.
neighborhood_overview: Parque das Nações is one of the most beautiful areas in Lisbon. You can go for a walk along Tagus river or relax in the beautiful gardens that surround the area. Nearby landmarks include: Torre Vasco da Gama, Lisbon Ocenarium, Pavilhão Atântico and many more.
host_about: I'm a dreamer and an entrepreneur. I'm a father of a beautiful boy that deserved a bigger house for playing around. The "old" house has we call it is available for anyone that would love to know more about lisbon or to have business in the area.

name: Quarto privado em Telheiras
description:
Large apartment, 3 bedrooms, located in Telheiras, one of the best areas of Lisbon, with metro to the door that allows to reach the center in 15m and to the airport in 20m.

Big apartment, with 3 bedrooms, in one of the best zones of Lisbon, served by metro.
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is a 10-minute walk from the University City of Lisbon and is located in a quiet downtown where people of classes A and B (middle and upper class) live predominantly; it is one of the neighborhoods at the European level with the highest concentration of graduates per square meter. In the neighborhood and nearby there are several important infrastructures, including good hospitals, clinics, restaurants, schools, cinema, gyms/gyms and police station 5 minutes from the apartment.
host_about:
Paulo Faustino teaches media marketing, management, economics and public policies in Bachelor’s, Master’s and Doctoral programs in national and international universities. In Portugal is assistant professor at Porto University. He also collaborates as teacher in media management, entrepreneurship, economics and marketing in the Media Communication School of Lisbon; and is visiting Professor in various international universities. He is president of Media XXI – Publishing, Consultancy and Research.
Paulo Faustino is Chairman of the International Media Management Academic Association (IMMAA) and was board member and co-founder of the European Association of Media Management Education (EMMA). Paulo Faustino has conducted consultancy work for several private and public institutions like, for example, the World Bank and the Portuguese Media Regulatory Entity. He was General Secretary of the Portuguese Media Confederation. Previously, he worked as adjunct for the State Secretary and Presidency Minister of the XV and XVI Constitutional Governments.
He was also an executive board advisor at Lusomundo Media (former media group from the Portugal Telecom’s group). Additionally, was Vice-President of the Portuguese Press Association, President of the Communication Observatory and board member of the Centre for Professional Training in Journalism (Cenjor). He is the author and co-author of nine books and circa twenty scientific articles published in national and international journals, as well as in books about media economics, public policies and management. Paulo Faustino published 7 books, 8 book chapters and 11 scientific articles. His research is focused on the Media and Creative Industries Studies, namely: Ownership Concentration, Public Policies, Economics, Management, Marketing, Entrepreneurship and Creative Industries.
He is a member of the editorial board of the following journals: The International Media Management Journal; Journal of Innovative Marketing; Journal of Spanish Language Media; Brands Trends Journal and Journal of Journalism and Mass Communication. Paulo Faustino has taken part in several international conferences and courses as a teacher, speaker, chairman, moderator, and as part of round tables, in the following countries: Angola, Mozambique, Canada, EUA, Brazil, China, Switzerland, German, Serbian, Macao, Japan, United Kingdom, Russian, Hungary, Cape Green, Guinea Bissau, Spain, France, Greece and Australia.Paulo Faustino teaches media marketing, management, economics and public policies in Bachelor’s, Master’s and Doctoral programs in national and international universities. name: Red table apartment
description:
Excellent apartment in the center of Lisbon. Great light in the spacious living room. About us, I'm an artist and my wife is an actress. We have two kids, one of 8 and 3 years old. Our house is colourful and bright with our works and equipment.
You'll have access to the bathroom, equipped kitchen, wireless internet, I-mac computer, pencils and paper. Actually we encourage you to use everything you need at our home and have a wonderful stay.
neighborhood_overview:
Red table apartment is near downtown (15min walking or 5 minutes metro),
There's a supermarket near by, a Pharmacy, a hospital, and a deli shop open 'til late, and a couple of portuguese "tascas".
There's a metro station 1 minute from my door.

Artist living in Lisbon. 
Loves drawing, nature, wife, sons, mother, father, siblings, friends, film grain and animals.

name: River view - Duplex in Principe Real
description: A 100 m2 duplex, ideal for two, located in the elegant, historic district of Principe Real. Away from the city hustle this apartment offers a magnificent view over the River Tagus, the 25th. April bridge, the statue of Christ and the dome of the Estrela Basilica.
neighborhood_overview:
Located on a quiet, residential street, just 5 mins walk away from the shops and restaurants of Principe Real, the botanical gardens and the delightful Praça das Flores with its local-style cafés that spill out onto patios and pavements.
For nearby supermarket shopping you have Pingo Doce and Mini Preço, as well as Amoreiras Shopping Centre (300m). Nearby Chiado and Bairro Alto set the scene for Lisbon nightlife.
Paço do Lumiar golf course is 10 mins away by car and the magnificent beaches of Caparica are 25 mins away by car (16 km).

name: Tua Lisboa *Américo Tomás Room*
description: Situated in a very central and lively area, Tua Lisboa Guesthouse is the perfect combination of style, comfort and location. We will provide all you need to make your stay impeccable and enjoy Lisbon at its best!
neighborhood_overview:
Tua Lisboa's location is ideal for visiting the fascinating museums in the area or having a stroll around the splendid Moorish-style bullring, venue of concerts, fairs and many more events throughout the year.
Avenida da República, where Tua Lisboa is situated, is house to many cafés, like the Art Nouveau-styled Pastelaria Versailles, where you can spend enjoyable afternoons away from the tourist crowds in historical center and get a more intimate travel experience by enjoying a bica (espresso) or imperial (draught beer) with locals after work.
With plenty of shops and malls, the area is also perfect for your shopping sprees and take home a piece of Portuguese fashion with you!
host_about: Tua Lisboa Guesthouse is a friendly and freshly renewed apartment located in Lisbon city center. Surrounded by museums, shops, cafés and parks, we are a great place to stay if you want to feel like a local and still have easy access to all main tourist attractions.

name: Casinha White Lotus Flower - Very Central!
description: My house ("casinha") is very cosy and it has being always pleasant to be here. Although traveling a lot, it has been a sweet to my soul to be back home. It is white and refreshing; in the way I see it, like a white lotus flower: light and beautiful. It has a room, a living-room, a small kitchen and a sweet bathroom with a bathtub. It has also a nice balcony! Very central location!
neighborhood_overview: My apartment its very central, right in the heart of Lisbon. As mentioned before, it stays between Rossio and Martim Moniz. This was the street with an arch until Graça and the Castle Hill, nowadays broken. Its ruins can still be seen just next to the house, on the second public stairs turning right when going from the house. There is also a nice urban lawn with a sight to the Castle, pleasant to see and nice to photograph.
host_about: Hi! I love to travel and to connect to new people and cultures. Recently I came back to Portugal after living about a decade abroad. I lived in Salzburg and Linz - Austria, from where I returned back in the end of 2014. It was a great experience and it helped to exercise the languages I appreciated to learn before. To learn about the country and its culture was also important to me. I studied both universities of Dancing and of Opera Singing (Lisbon/Salzburg and Linz, respectively) and I use to feel home when creating new things. In Linz I had my own created group of theater, a year-project of an amazing exchange of artistic expressions, like music, dancing, theater, but also painting, video-art and free-exhibition. So, I'm interested in fine arts as well; and happy to be around artists! My little apartment has being the place to be when returned back in Portugal. Although, now the time to be back in the Nature has come and I may be happy to open the doors of my "little and cosy palace" in the centre of Lisbon to the ones who deserve it! Feel free to come over!   Susana

name: Sta Catarina apartment with a view
description: Amazing apartment, with an excellent and privilege location in the heart of Lisbon, where everything happens within a walking distance. It is the perfect base point to discover the city, starting in a beautiful terrace with a magnificent view over it
neighborhood_overview:
The house is in old Santa Catarina neighborhood with a central and perfect location for walking around in the narrow streets.
In an authentic Portuguese atmosphere you can find here restaurants, bars, cafes, grocery shops and transports.
Here you have one of the best viewpoints of Lisbon, the Miradouro de Santa Catarina, just one minute distance from the house. There you can have a meal or just a drink, or just relaxing while you embrace the incredible view of Lisbon and the Tagus River.
Just nearby you also have the Elevador da Bica, which is a funicular and a marking point of Lisbon.
The famous 28 Tram also stops here, just around the corner!
This a quiet neighborhood with limited car access so, you can have all the comfort and privacy here to enjoy your stay.
host_about:
I love meeting people and cultures from all around the world, it is a real privilege..
But what i like the most is my beautiful city, Lisbon, so here’s an invitation to come and visit!

name: Aldeia da Mata Pequena (6 persons)
description: Aldeia da Mata Pequena, an old village carefully restored invites to explore nature and built heritage of its surroundings. 13 houses offering a B&B, self-catering and comfortable accommodation in a traditional atmosphere.
neighborhood_overview:
Situated barely 30 minutes from the capital Lisbon, Aldeia da Mata Pequena is also close to beautiful beaches and historic places, offering excellent opportunities for outdoor activities.

It is located within the Special Protection Area of Penedo do Lexim, an extinct volcano, where there is an important archaeological site. Proud eagles and stealthy foxes inhabit an extremely rich and well-preserved natural landscape, inviting visitors to relax, to indulge in leisure activities and to be in contact with nature.

name: Hot Ericeira - Blue sea
description:
Brand new remodeled apartment with all the commodities, Ericeira city center.
Enjoy the beaches in a 200m distance, restaurants, shops, nightlife and surf spirit of the village, all in a walking distance from home.
neighborhood_overview:
To make the most of your days in Ericeira you must go out and explore this charming village. Increasingly sought by surfers, its beaches are one of the highlights and of mandatory visit. Relax in one of the beach bars or, if you're a surf lover, venture into the famous waves of Ericeira! Also, you will have to try the local cuisine: fish and seafood take the spotlight and Lobster Açorda or Lombaça are some of the specialties!

For relaxed holidays nothing better than to rent this apartments! Stay here discover this beautiful village by the sea!

name: Guincho Studio
description: This lovely studio has just been renovated. It is one large space, with the sleeping area separated from the living area by a thin but acoustic wall. There is another small room with a large single bed. There is a bathroom, a small kitchen and French doors opening onto a garden with olive trees.
neighborhood_overview: Guincho Studio is located in the cute village of Charneca, on the border of the Sintra-Cascais Natural Park. It is a couple of minutes drive from Guincho beach (or 20min by foot, through a green valley and sand dunes), 5 min drive from Cascais and 25 min drive from Lisbon. There is a bus stop just outside the property with regular services to Cascais. From Cascais, there is a train where you'll reach Lisbon in about 40 min.
host_about:
My Friends' Houses is a network of rental accommodation in the UK, Portugal, Greece, France and Bali. Despite the diverse scope of the holiday destinations the common thread is that all the homes available provide a cosy, well loved environment with on hand support and advice if required.
We work closely with all of our owners to ensure their houses meet a high standard. When our guests arrive at My Friends' Houses, they can immediately enjoy and relax! 
It is important to us that from the moment you put down your suitcase you feel comfortable and able to kick back and enjoy your holiday.

All our houses are handpicked and the regions we work with are well known to us. This way, we can give real advice to our guests and make them feel like staying at a “Friend’s House”.
We offer a variety of activities and places where you will be able to go and be received “like a friend”.  We can recommend the best contacts for yoga, surfing, kite-surfing, paddle boarding, eco tourism and bird watching, sailing, trekking, horse-riding, tennis, massages and beauty treatments, cultural and historical tours as well as amazing gastronomic experiences!
Anything else you fancy, let us know and we will find a way to provide it!
We look forward to welcoming you at “My Friends’ Houses”.

name: Sao Paulo 90- Spacious and renovated apartment
description:
In a carefully renovated 1800’s building with original features on display, this comfortable apartment is located in the central riverside Cais do Sodré.
Spacious, recently renovated, combining classical architecture with modern style, and benefiting from a lot of light, this apartment is in the trendiest areas of the city. The building is within walking distance of Chiado and Bairro Alto Districts, and only 5 min’ walk from Lisbon's biggest food market: Mercado da Ribeira /Time Out Market.
host_about:
Hi! My name is Sofia, I am portuguese but lived most of my life in Madrid. I moved back to Lisbon in 2015 to embrace new challenges. I help my father in the family business by taking care of customer service at JCBessa Lda. 
I am passionate about gardening, cooking, spending time in the nature and my dogs of course ;)

name: The Barbecue Palace
description:
Amazing 4 bedroom apartment at the heart of the city. 5 min walking from the beach close to Cascais and Sintra.
You’ll love this apartment because of the Location, Perfect for Barbecues and to enjoy the sunshine. My place is excellent for couples, business travellers, families and group of friends.
neighborhood_overview: The fact that the neighbourhood is in a quiet area close to transports and most important close to the beach and the beautiful MARGINAL ( N6 a road by the beach that can take you from Lisbon to Cascais with breathtaking view).
host_about:
Hello, I have a beautiful apartment in very good condition, perfect if you want to visit Lisbon, Cascais and Sintra. Situated 5 minutes walking from the beach and 5 minutes walking from the train station. This apartment is perfect for a big family or friends that want to enjoy holidays in Lisbon.
I was born in Oeiras(Lisbon) but I now live in London with my wife and kids. I bought this apartment for my holidays has we go to Lisbon every year in the summer. Diogo is in charge of the house when I'm not there, he speaks ingles and knows the best places to have fun in Lisbon.
neighbourhood_cleansed: Oeiras e S.Julio da Barra, Pao de Arcos e Caxias

Please introduce yourself with a photograph, interaction is much more pleasant 🤗

The house has plenty of light and is very welcoming.
The house is in the center of Lisbon, but in a quiet neighborhood.

The house is suitable for couples, business travelers and families (with children).

name: Conforto no centro de Lisboa
description:
A minimalist and elegant apartment situated in one of Lisbon's charming neighbourhoods.
Situated on a first floor in the Alvalade district, it is the ideal apartment for those who want a comfortable stay in a cozy environment. Fully equipped, you will find a surprising touch of refinement in each room. Experience the waterfall shower on shale walls, sleep in a comfortable and bright room specially decorated so it feels like home.

name: Central Lisbon, near all sites and transport links
description:
Our lovely, airy apartment is in the heart of central Lisbon. All the sites and transport are just a short walk away. Light-filled and newly renovated, it is charming and stylish with two sunny terraces.

Airport transfer available! Fast Wifi!

Just below the castle it is within easy reach of Martim Moniz, a major transport hub with a metro line, buses and the famous Number 28 tram. The neighbourhood is traditional but quiet with many trendy shops, bars and restaurants nearby.

name: The Whale House - Lovely cottage near the beach!
description:
The perfect beach house! All for you!
Where local surfers live, just 5km (8min by car) away from Ericeira's hectic center. And 2km (10min walk) away from local surf spot São Julião's beach.

A tipical portuguese country house with all that matters - a big garden to enjoy to barbecue some fresh fish and eat outside with your family or friends, after a good day of yoga, sunbathing or catching waves!
We'll be glad to give all the locals best infos about your stay!

The Whale House awaits you!
neighborhood_overview:
Baleia is a small village, that grew around São Julião's beach, one of the most beautiful beaches in Ericeira.
It is a quiet and safe area. We know almost all our neighbours here (and probably you will too after a few days in The Whale House), you will meet them at the ocean and it is common to see them (and me!) watching the sunshine everyday at the beach.
You won't have to leave Baleia if you don't want to, you have a tipical portuguese caffe at your doorstep, the best bread in the world 400mts away, the best surfboard shaper atelier in town "Mica" is your neighbour, a minimarket 300mts away, "Anabela" the lady that sells vegetables from her garden every weekend...
host_about:
Hello! 
My name is Sofia!

I'm a passionate young woman keen for neurosciences, that loves a good conversation and an honest laugh.

The travel bug bit me long ago so everytime I can I try to satisfy my need =)
As a guest you can expect from me to take care of your house as if it was my own.

The enthusiasm of welcoming others to my house however showed up later and what started as an hobby became a job (a really good one!) =)
Therefore, you can expect to find in me a host that truly wants to provide the best holiday experience that she can.

See you around!

name: Cosy bedroom in Belem (single)
description:
PT. The house is a 10 min. walk from the Belém area, near the Belém Tower and Jerónimos Monastery. Transportes públicos a 5 min (autocarro e eléctrico).
EN. The house is near Belém historic area (10 to 15 min. walk to Jerónimos Monastery and Belém Tower, both UNESCO World Heritage) and the Champalimaud Foundation. Public transportation at 5 min. walk can take you to city center. Train station (10 min. walk) can take you to city center or to Estoril and Cascais.
neighborhood_overview:
The house is located in the Restelo neighborhood, known for its quietness and a good location for transports. It's 5 minutes walking to the Belém Tower, Jerónimos Monastery, Tagus riverside, among others.
There're grocery stores and restaurants next to the house.

name: Guest House - Santa Bica - Eat, Drink & Sleep
description:
Located in the Bica neighborhood, at the heart of the city, this place gathers unique conditions for a stay in Lisbon.

Featuring a restaurant and a daily Continental breakfast, Santa Bica Eat Drink & Sleep is a charming Lisbon B&B. Set in the city’s historic centre, the unit is just steps from the iconic Bica Funicular. .

Each air-conditioned room comes with a private bathroom with free toiletries. The unit is set in a renovated historical building, which used to be a traditional bakery.
neighborhood_overview:
Historic neighborhood known for its elevator, connects Bairro Alto to Cais do Sodré, being a key artery in the city’s history, and its relationship with the Tejo River.

Nearby is Chiado, with all its cultural offer (theaters, museums and concert halls) and its streets filled with exquisite stores, the Bairro Alto, and its renowned nightlife, the Baixa, characterized by its wonderful architecture and traditional commerce, and Cais do Sodré, with the charming Mercado da Ribeira and intermodal terminal that leads to the beaches of Cascais.

The Santa Catarina Belvedere is a 2-minute walk and features stunning city and Tagus River views. Chiado is 500 m away, while Rossio is within a 14-minute walk. São Jorge’s Castle is 2.9 km away. The Santa Bica Eat Drink & Sleep is 9 km from Lisbon Portela Airport.

Misericordia is a great choice for travellers interested in friendly people, food and architecture.
host_about:
Located in the Bica neighborhood, at the heart of the city, this place gathers unique conditions for a stay in Lisbon, a late afternoon amongst friends and delicacies, or a late visit for a glass of wine.
On the street of the Bica elevator, a Lisbon city icon, this former bakery and factory are the perfect pretext for this new spot, where communion and retreat coexist in harmony.
We regained a place once abandoned and gave it back to the city, to the people, uniting traditional ways of eating habits with those of living together, around a table.
The patio is the perfect culmination of this place, where we can look at the river over the rooftops and concentrate on the elevator. Here, a lemon tree is an ancient and permanent inhabitant, ensuring coolness on sunny afternoons.

name: Faramilo: Private House with Beautiful View & Pool
description: You'll love our house set in the slopes of Sintra's mountains, with landscape views of the countryside and Colares vineyards. It's a studio with a private entrance consisting of a bedroom with french doors to the terrace, living and dining room, a kitchenette and a full bathroom. It is a short drive to all the sights of Sintra: Monserrate Park and Palace, Pena Palace, Quinta da Regaleira, Adraga Beach. It's perfect for couples, small groups, and solo adventurers.
neighborhood_overview: It is a short walk from the house to the small village of Colares, where there are authentic Portuguese restaurants, grocery stores, and a few shops. From the house, it is a 10-minute drive to the beaches, and a 15-minute drive to downtown Sintra where you can visit the Quinta de Regaleira, the Park and National Palace of Pena, and many restaurants and tourist shops.

CAMPO D'OURIQUE / AMOREIRAS | Campo de Ourique is a neighborhood with its own life in the heart of Lisbon. upper-middle class residential area and with a great tradition of trade, is considered one of the city's neighborhoods with better quality of life.
Here it will not be difficult to see people greet themselves, families strolling and shopping. Politicians, artists and journalists choose Campo de Ourique to live and live. Situated between Amoreiras, Estrela and Prazeres.

Initially boiled down to a windy slope where they live the workers of Alcântara factories. The Campo de Ourique streets are lined with shops, cafes, pastry shops, offices and offices. The two electrical, 25 (Customs / Campo de Ourique) and 28 (Martim Moniz / Campo de Ourique), make mobility easier and give a certain charm. The apartament is situated in the old part of Alfama with many climbs and downs ( very typical in the old Lisbon neighborhoods )
Very close to the tram 28 stop, fado restaurants and nice point of view´s!

As the apartment is situated in the Heart of Alfama, you have everything within a walking distance: cafes and restaurants, supermarkets, pharmacies, shops, transport, as well as the main tourist attractions.

name: Marchesa de Bica Luxury Apartment - A safe home
description: This 300m2 apartment from the XVII Century lived the Marchesa de Bica, an extraordinary lady that dedicated her live in prol of others. A gifted women in a time when in Portugal women were not seen as equals. She persevered in the domain of the arts and achieved a reputation amongst fellow artists. This apartment was renovated with charm and taste leaving some  vestiges of ancient times. The restored stone arcades & pavement in the Master bedroom from the VXII century amongst other reliques.
neighborhood_overview: Located just 200 m from Mercado da Ribeira and at the footsteps of Elevador da Bica that takes you to the Chiado in less then 5 min, Marchesa da Bica is at the perfect spot to make your city discovery an amazing one.
host_about: I am from Portugal and currently living in HCMC, due to my husband's Expatriation in Vietnam. I love Lisbon and it's energy, clear and beautiful light and amazing Adrenaline. We have bought our apartment thinking to enjoy it every time we would come Home, meanwhile during the time we are away we would like to rent it to friends and others that have the some joy for the simple and yet elegant pleasures of life...

Very close to the tram 28 stop, fado restaurants and nice point of view´s!
You will listen Fado music in all the typical restaurants and on the streets. During the summer ( starting in the end of May ) you will have the most important party in Lisbon ( SANTO ANTÓNIO ) this party will take all June and everyone is eating sardinnes and have fun in the streets!

name: Homely mini flat with garden and pool, Parede
description: We have a bright and comfortable two bedroom flat with private bathroom and kitchen. The flat is on the ground floor of  the house leading on to the garden. neighborhood_overview:
There are plenty of small grocery shops, café and good local restaurants nearby for eating out. We are 5 mins drive to several beautiful beaches. The house sits behind Jardins de Parede, less than 2 km from S. João de Estoril Beach. There are several parks nearby and playgrounds for children.
The house is closely situated to the beaches if you would like to relax or if you would like a more active holiday you can paddle board, snorkel, dive or surf. A rental car is ideal if walking is not your thing.
host_about: My partner and myself have lived fourteen years in the Lisbon- Cascais area. We work and live here and love everything Portugal has to offer. We love the culture, Portuguese people, history and the amazing standard of living. I was brought up with parents who rented their properties so I grew up meeting new people and making sure they had a good time during their stay.  We would like to do the same in our own home.

name: Príncipe cosy house in Lisbon's oldtown
description:
This cosy apartment is located in one of the main historical districts of Lisbon. It is next to the Príncipe Real garden, where every saturday you can buy typical products in the organic market and then cook them at home with views of the city, the Tagus river and the 25 de Abril bridge.
Although small, the apartment has plenty of natural light and is very comfortable for a couple with 2 children or up to 2 young couples friends.
neighborhood_overview:
Botanical Garden, Mirador São Pedro de Alcântara and São Luiz Theater. These are only 3 of the dozens of places to visit that are within walking distance from the house.
The Príncipe Real neighbourhood is known for its restaurants, from traditional to gourmet food, shops, galleries, gardens, belvederes and a few bars (some of which are part of the city's gay circuit).
It is a beautiful neighbourhood to walk and quiet, that still conserves in its buildings the old traces of Lisbon, many of them with the famous tiles in the facades.
It also has the advantage of being close to the busiest places in the city centre.
It's 3 min. walking distance from Bairro Alto and 10/15 min. Baixa and Cais do Sodré, and other districts of a great day and night attractions, with many restaurants, cafes, bars, belvederes with beautiful views of Lisbon, shows, shops, typical Lisbon lifts, etc.
I will be happy to provide more information and tips when arriving in Lisbon.

name: House in Belém
description:
Apartment with lots of light in a quiet street and overlooking the river Tagus.
Located in a noble area of Lisbon, its strong points are museums and gastronomy.
In a short walk around the neighborhood you can get a sense of what a typical Lisbon neighborhood is, visit ancient palaces and monasteries, visit the most modern museums in the city, relax in gardens or by the river Tagus and taste the best food that the capital can offer.
Ideal for those who want to have a relaxed stay.
neighborhood_overview:
What makes the district of Belém unique is the fact that the two most visited monuments in Portugal belong to it: Torre de Belém and Jerónimos Monastery, as well as the official residence of the President of the Republic, Belém Palace.
Adding to this, there is a whole cultural, landscape and gastronomic offer, and the fact of being able to visit this diversity of spaces without needing to use any transport, makes Belém one of the most sought after by Portuguese and foreigners to spend pleasant days.
In addition to the fact that it is an old quarter of Lisbon, with a residential aspect, there is a calm environment in the immediate surroundings of all these attractions.
I will be happy to provide you with more information on your arrival in Lisbon.

Chiado Lisbon Lounge Suites is offering a luxurious 3 room penthouse in downtown Lisbon, with a beautiful view of the Tagus river. Accommodates up to 6 people and includes an option for private parking (30€/day)

This luxurious space has direct access to Rua Garrett which, with its highly recognized identity, is one of the most traditional streets of Lisbon.

name: 18th Century House in a Charming Village Portugal
description:
Discover the charm of Quinta da Capela, an 18th century jewel located in the picturesque village of Sabugo in Sintra. Situated in the middle of a village of about 1,500 inhabitants, Sabugo is a true historical gem filled with local traditions and culture.
Enjoy breathtaking views of the Serra de Sintra, with spectacular sunsets. Just 12 km from Sintra, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, offers a plethora of attractions including the Palace of Pena, Quinta da Regaleira and much more.
neighborhood_overview:
The Sabugo is a village with about 1500 inhabitants, rich in history, traditions and popular culture. It was a crossing point of our Kings when they went to Mafra that they stopped here to refresh themselves and give water to the animals in the fountain built in the reign of D. João V, in the year 1782. Sintra, just 12 km away, is a World Heritage Site (Unesco), with many places to visit including: Museum of Modern Art, Moorish Castle, Village Palace; Pena Palace, Quinta da Regaleira, etc. Musical shows and other cultural events in the Sintra area are published in a dossier for consultation.
Points of interest
• Sintra (12 Km)
• Beautiful Golf Club (2km)
• Lisbon Sports Club - Golf (2 km)
• Lisbon (25km)
• Beach - Cascais (25km), Guincho (30km), Ericeira Surf Beach world class (30km)
• Mafra (18 km)
• Cabo da Roca (35 km)
• Cascais (20 km)
• Belas Village (4 km)

description:
Charming, cozy and sunny apartment ideally located besides Av da Liberdade in Baixa area perfect for a family or for 4 adults + 1 baby !

It is a 58 m2 flat, with one bedroom, a living room with a double comfortable sofa bed, a fully equipped kitchen, a bathroom with tub and a very sunny garden.

The apartment is situated in a steep hill near all major transportation: Trams, buses, trains towards Sintra and Cascais, and subway lines - in 10/15 minutes walking distance from the apartment.
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is perfect for our guests to get the feeling of a typical Lisbon neighborhood.

They can take part of the typical rituals of a Lisboner and still be near of major touristic places, so it’s perfect to fall in love with Lisbon!

The apartment is near groceries, restaurants and cafés.

name: The Marquis -Curated Designer Apartment near Beach
description:
Start planning your BBQ on the private patio - the perfect place to stay with your loved ones. Enjoy the comfort of this very spacious apartment, with an open-plan living area, an enormous kitchen, mid-century modern aesthetic, designer furnishings, and an outdoor dining space. You can relax or work from home, be inspired by the peace of the setting, and take a beautiful daily walk/run along the park and the beach. Just steps from the farmers market, pharmacy, supermarkets and several top restaurants with take out alternatives. The Marquis is your spacious sunny home, away from home.

With its high-end interior design and modern amenities, the beautiful The Marquis will ensure your complete comfort and reenergising. A spacious living room, large kitchen with modern appliances and a king-bed bedroom and bathroom. Looking over the park, with spectacular sunset views from the living room. The house is at the heart of the historic center of Oeiras, a typical Portuguese town - ped
neighborhood_overview: Oeiras historic center is a gem we fell in love with in 2015 when we returned to Portugal. A beautiful safe town on a sandy beach, with cobblestone streets where you can walk or cycle, a perfect sense of community, lots of History with the Palace, the church, the well kept romantic parks, fabulous and diverse food options (traditional and modern), art galleries, theaters, markets, museums, the marina with all its outdoor and ocean options, and less than 20 minutes from downtown Lisbon, Sintra and Cascais. Some call it Lisbon's beach district, we call it home.
host_about:
We lived many years abroad (ask us where!) and 5 years ago we moved back to Portugal - we picked the town of Oeiras, the best place in the world for our amazing children to grow up in! They say there's no place like home and it's really true for us, we are so happy here! Our new home is just outside Lisbon, in a little known gem called old town Oeiras :)
Catarina has a business consulting and non-profit background, has recently published a novel and is the proud owner of the best Nail Spa in Lisbon. Rui is a talented architect and certified chef! We love traveling, dancing, meeting people, teaching and learning from our kids, and we're also happy to just sit back with a glass of fine wine after the little ones go to bed, absorbing all the sunset tones. Fast pace, slow pace, there's time for everything. Life is magical and we try to make the best of it, wherever it may be!
neighbourhood_cleansed: Oeiras e S.Julio da Barra, Pao de Arcos e Caxias

name: Jardins da Gandarinha Apartment by Sol Domus
description:
The apartment, in a private condominium in one of the best residential areas of Cascais, is situated on the 4th floor, with lift access. The entrance hall leads to the living area, that opens onto the terrace via two doors. The living room boasts a fully equipped kitchen with breakfast area.
2 bedrooms: 1 big and with terrace and the 1 twin bedroom is internal, accessed from the living room.
Both the living room and bigger bedroom have air conditioning.
The condominium has 24h security.
neighborhood_overview:
O centro de Cascais pode ser alcançado a pé, como também todas as suas atrações, o apartamento é situado na procurada zona residencial da Guia em Cascais O oceano Atlântico localiza-se a 500 metros, juntamente com o passeio marítimo até ao centro de Cascais numa direção e a praia do Guincho na outra.
Existe um pequeno centro comercial perto e um parque infantil. A encantadora Casa da Guia à beira mar e no topo da arriba dispões de lojas e restaurantes, tornando-a num local mágico.
O charmoso centro histórico de Cascais é a uma distância de 15 minutos a pé ou 3 minutos de carro. Há muito para visitar, como restaurantes, vida noturna, eventos culturais, cinemas e compras.
Esta propriedade é idealmente situada para aqueles que querem fazer uma pausa com muito para fazer mas sem precisar de alugar um carro.



Praia do Guincho

name: Tua Lisboa *Eanes Room*
description: Situated in a very central and lively area, Tua Lisboa Guesthouse is the perfect combination of style, comfort and location. We will provide all you need to make your stay impeccable and enjoy Lisbon at its best!
neighborhood_overview:
Tua Lisboa's location is ideal for visiting the fascinating museums in the area or having a stroll around the splendid Moorish-style bullring, venue of concerts, fairs and many more events throughout the year.
Avenida da República, where Tua Lisboa is situated, is house to many cafés, like the Art Nouveau-styled Pastelaria Versailles, where you can spend enjoyable afternoons away from the tourist crowds in historical center and get a more intimate travel experience by enjoying a bica (espresso) or imperial (draught beer) with locals after work.
With plenty of shops and malls, the area is also perfect for your shopping sprees and take home a piece of Portuguese fashion with you!
host_about: Tua Lisboa Guesthouse is a friendly and freshly renewed apartment located in Lisbon city center. Surrounded by museums, shops, cafés and parks, we are a great place to stay if you want to feel like a local and still have easy access to all main tourist attractions.

description:
With stunning views over the Serra de Sintra and Palácio da Pena, this farm dating from the 18th century is in the village of Sabugo, Sintra.
A Cavalariça (6 pax) has 3 bedrooms (1 double and 2 twin), 2 WC, kitchen and living room with sofa bed.

Sintra, just 12 km away, is a World Heritage Site (Unesco), with many places to visit, including: Modern Art Museum, Moorish Castle, Village Palace; Pena Palace, Regaleira Quinta, etc. Musical performances and other cultural events in the Sintra area are disseminated in a dossier for consultation.

name: 3. Pepe's Spacious Room with shared bathroom
description:
If you are looking for a quiet place to stay in Lisbon's outskirts, this is your perfect place!
You will have your private room and a bathroom shared outside the room.
There are 4 single beds and one double bed
It is a 20-30min drive from the city centre, 20min from the Airport.
We have airport transfers available for 20eur and we can drive you around Lisbon, Cascais, Sintra, Ericeira...
If you are coming to Lisbon on business this is also perfect as we have the main highways 5 min away.
neighborhood_overview: The house is located in a quiet neighborhood (Casal de Cambra) in the countryside of Lisbon // Metro blue line "Pontinha": 10min drive, 20min by bus. // Supermarket, pharmacy, coffee places, restaurants: 5min walking // Shopping mall "Dolce Vita Tejo": 5min drive // Highway CREL/A9/CRIL: 5min drive

name: Veranda in Santo Amaro
description: The hostel is very well located. It has free parking. The train station is within walking distance. Free WIFI and TV available. The house is on the ground floor of the building and has a veranda with view over a garden, the city and the river. The veranda is a fantastic place to relax and enjoy. There is on sleeping-room and one living-room, each division has one big bed. Original paintings make the apartment a unique and atmospheric place.
neighborhood_overview: The "Santo Amaro" district has a train station of the same name, which enables local transport to the capital Lisbon. The beach of Santo Amaro is 1 km and the nearest surfing beach 2 km from the apartment. The residential area is quiet and has a soccer field and playground for children. A grocery store, pharmacy and cafes are just 200 meters away. A shady botanical garden "Parque dos Sete Castelos" is on the way to the train station.
host_about: Hello! My name is Elisa Regnier and I welcome you to my beautiful apartment in Oeiras. My family and I live near by. Therefore we can easily get in contact with the guests. I hope that you will enjoy to be in Oeiras as much as we do.

name: Casas d'Amouraria - Apartamentos com 1 Quarto
description:
Mouraria is one of the most emblematic neighborhoods in Lisbon, located in close proximity to the Castle and the City Centre.

Just a 5-minute walk from the heart of the city and a 10-minute walk to the imposing Castle and the charming Alfama area.

Our one-bedroom apartments are the ideal choice for couples looking for a romantic getaway or for small families looking to explore Lisbon!
neighborhood_overview: It is said that this is where our dear Fado was born. The music of the people rose to prominence in the Portuguese aristocracy thanks to the famous Severa, who, supported by the Count of Vimioso, enchanted with his voice in the bullfights and the feasts of the nobility. Today, Mouraria is known as Lisbon's most multicultural neighborhood and is in the spotlight of real estate investors. Make sure to visit the Taborda Theatre and the Chapitô.

Cascais Riviera Villa is located in one of the best residential areas of Cascais, Guia. The spacious vacation villa in Cascais boasts four terraces and a garden with small private swimming pool. Private garden with 7m*4m heated pool – on request (€50/day supplement applies).
The villa is ideal for indoor-outdoor living.

Air conditioned throughout, Villa Riviera has been fully refurbished in 2017. It provides the ideal setting for a convivial vacation with everything close-by.
neighborhood_overview:
Cascais Riviera Villa is situated in the very sought after Guia residential area in Cascais.
A short walk from Casa da Guia and its magnificent cliff-top restaurants. The Ocean is 1000m away and the beautiful coastal walk links the Centre of Cascais in one direction and Guincho beach in the other.

name: Cascais 72 Garden Apartment by Sol-Domus
description: Welcome to our newly fully refurbished 3 bedroom Cascais Riviera Garden Apartment by Sol Domus!  One great feature of the apartment is the private little garden and pool! The apartment is bright and spacious and has air conditioning throughout.
neighborhood_overview:
Within walking distance of the centre of Cascais and all its amenities, the apartment is situated in the very sought after Guia residential area in Cascais, a short walk from Casa da Guia and its magnificent cliff-top restaurants. The Ocean is 500m away and the beautiful coastal walk links the Centre of Cascais in one direction and Guincho beach in the other.
There is a small local shopping centre walking distance, as well as a local children playground 2 minutes walk.

The delightful Casa da Guia by the sea with its shops and restaurants is a pleasant stroll away; Casa da Guia is a truly magical place.
The charming, historic town centre of Cascais is a pleasant 20 minutes stroll, or 3 minutes by car. There is plenty to visit such as restaurants, nightlife, cultural events, cinemas with films in English and shopping.
This property is ideally situated for those wanting to take a break with plenty to do but without having to rent a car.

name: Terraços das Olarias Piscina-Apartamento 2 Quartos
description:
Mouraria is one of Lisbon's best-known neighborhoods, since it is so close to the Castle and downtown area.

Just a 5-minute walk to the city center and a 10-minute walk to Alfama's castle and upper area.

Our two-bedroom apartment with swimming pool will be the best option for a family or friends trip.
neighborhood_overview:
Miradouro da Graça - 10 minutes walk
When leaving your apartment, turn left onto Rua dos Lagares. After 200 meters, on your left go up the stairs (Ladders of the Snail), and you will find the Viewpoint.
From Transportation: Take tram 28 at Martim Moniz Square. Get off the tram in the neighborhood of Grace.

Miradouro da Senhora do Monte - 15 minutes walk
When leaving your apartment, on your right side go up Rua Manuel Soares Guedes and then the Escadinhas de Damasceno Monteiro. Climb the stairs until you reach the Viewpoint.

Viewpoint Santa-Luzia - 10 minutes walk
When leaving your apartment, follow Rua dos Lagares. Continue straight ahead, passing the Calçada de Santo André. Cross Praça Travessa do Açougue and continue straight on Rua de São Tomé, which will take you to Portas do Sol and Miradouro de Santa Luzia.
By Transportation: Go down to Martim Moniz Square and take tram 28.

Castelo São Jorge - 15/20 minutes walk

name: Cascais garden & pool house
description: Cozy stand alone pool house with double sofa bed with living room and equipped kitchen. Independent bathroom with shower next door. Pay TV and  wifi. Pool and deck available for your private use. One-car parking space and private entrance. 2 bicycles available. Bus line on same street. Ideal for single or couples. The house next door is ours, in case you need any help.
neighborhood_overview:
CASCAIS IS THE FINEST RESORT TOWN OF THE LISBON REGION.
Cascais is a delightful Portuguese fishing town, and is the Lisbon’s coastline most popular holiday destination. The town is situated on a beautiful coastline, and during the summer it is a bustling resort, with a buzzing holiday atmosphere.
Historically, Cascais was a minor fishing village, until King Luís I (1838 - 1889) choose it as his royal summer retreat. Trailing the Portuguese nobility were the high society of Portugal, who in turn constructed lavish villas, ornate mansions and exquisite gardens. Today, Cascais is an elegant fusion of decorative 19th-century architecture, traditional Portuguese charm and outstanding tourist facilities, which together creates a magnificent holiday destination.

Cascais also makes for an enjoyable day trip from Lisbon, by offering historic buildings, interesting museums and a pretty town centre. As for beaches, there are two distinct coastlines; to the east are calm, fami
host_about: French and Argentine nationalities. Grew up in Brazil, lived in Argentina, England, Spain, France, USA, Netherlands. Married, 2 children. Speak English, Portuguese, Spanish and some french.
